metadata.title: CVE-2019-16865 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Pillow before 6.2.0. When reading speciallycrafted invalid image files, the library can either allocate very largeamounts of memory or take an extremely long period of time to process theimage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16865` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-imaging - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.3
python-pil - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.3
python-pil.imagetk - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.3
python3-pil - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.3
python3-pil.imagetk - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pillow package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.1.2-0ubuntu1.3').
